title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: There is no one herebesides His Excellency, young Trevelyan, and ColonelJekyll, Lord Houghton's private secretary, and a son ofSir Bernard Burke's, now in the army, whom I remembera handsome young page to the Marlboroughs, when I wasat Dublin Castle in the sixties. The Lodge is a comfortable dwelling, but looks as if itrequired a thorough cleaning, both outwardly and inwardly. I wandered in the grounds in the gloaming, and copiedthese pretty lines inscribed on a stone monument in thegarden.
